title: Tulisa parties with Love Island's Maura and Curtis at awards ceremony
text:
It’s a look (Picture: Backgrid)

Tulisa Contostavlos rocked a lilac purple power suit on Tuesday as she attended the annual Specsavers’ Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards.

The N-Dubz star turned The X Factor judge turned solo singer wore the bold outfit paired with silver hair and sky-high deep purple heels.

The 31-year-old accessorised with a fun pair of black square frames and was joined by the likes of Spencer Matthews and wife Vogue Williams, and Love Island’s Maura Higgins – who also wore a power suit – and boyfriend Curtis Pritchard.

The event, held at 8 Northumberland Avenue, saw Maura turn heads in the suit which featured a daring neckline that saw the jacket clasp together at her abdomen.

The reality star paired her white outfit – brave – with a red lip and perspex heels, while she also wore large black frames.

Tulisa wore the bold outfit paired with silver hair and sky-high deep purple heels (Picture: Backgrid)

In September Tulisa – who was Little Mix’s mentor on The X Factor in 2011 – tweeted a supportive message praising her pal Jesy Nelson, after the singer opened up about her suicide attempt.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Jesy, 28, revealed she’d tried to take her own life in 2013 after being overwhelmed with vile taunts from online trolls about her looks on a daily basis. In response, Tulisa praised her for ‘rising above the dark times’.

The 31-year-old accessorised with a fun pair of black square frames (Picture: Backgrid)

Maura and Curtis are still going strong (Picture: Wenn)

The Young singer wrote: ‘Dear Jesy. What a brave, beautiful, talented and loved girl you are.’

She went on: ‘Knowing you were going through all of this in silence breaks my heart but to see the person you have become, rise above the dark times and now be in a place to help others shows the world just how strong you have always been.’

Maura turned heads in the suit which featured a daring neckline (Picture: Wenn)

Tulisa, who has a secret group chat with Little Mix, signed off: ‘I love you Jesy.’

Tulisa previously lifted the lid on a potential X Factor comeback, explaining she had had secret chats with producers on whether she could return over the years.

‘There have been years where I’ve spoken to them, [had meetings] and wanted the job [and] it’s not happened,’ she told Metro.co.uk.

‘It’s not something that I’m not shutting down, I would be open to it if they want to have a conversation with me but it’s just not at the forefront.’

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.
